intro: Eriospermum ciliatum, commonly known as the silky eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are small and typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions.
